comments.body:
nit: All existing tests in this rc.go file are using `f.Namespace.Name` in these functions.
So it is nice to use `f.Namespace.Name` directly like the other tests and create another cleanup PR if really necessary to cover the other tests.
This comes into my mind because here is a common part for all tests in this rc.go file but this `ns` is only used in additional test code.
I implemented it this way because it was written like this in [test/e2e/apps/disruption.go:L65-L72](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/e2e/apps/disruption.go#L65-L72)
Nit that can be addressed in followup PR: this is a magic number that could use some explanation.  Why was three minutes chosen?

It seemed to fail on shorter times due to other tests, I believe.
There was another test where in last week's meeting [this was discussed](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/88778#issuecomment-603470581).

> @BobyMCbobs 180 seconds was chosen was initially at or below 60, it seemed.. I changed it to make it unflakey. Happy to change it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +135,139 @@
		// setup a watch for the RC
		rcWatchTimeoutSeconds := int64(180)
		rcWatch, err := f.ClientSet.CoreV1().ReplicationControllers(testRcNamespace).Watch(context.TODO(), metav1.ListOptions{LabelSelector: "test-rc-static=true", TimeoutSeconds: &rcWatchTimeoutSeconds})
		framework.ExpectNoError(err, "Failed to setup watch on newly created ReplicationController")

comments.body: I don't see any value in having the release specified here. Nobody will update it and it'll just rot. The rest is ok.

I understand, but the reason I proposed this to the conformance group is to track when a conformance test is added or when it is modified. This is a free form string and up to the reviewer to pay attention to it. All this meta data will show up in a document like https://github.com/cncf/k8s-conformance/blob/master/docs/KubeConformance-1.9.md

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +40,44 @@
	/*
		Release : v1.9
		Testname: Replication Controller, run basic image
		Description: Replication Controller MUST create a Pod with Basic Image and MUST run the service with the provided image. Image MUST be tested by dialing into the service listening through TCP, UDP and HTTP.

comments.body: Golint comments: should have a package comment, unless it's in another file for this package. [More info](https://golang.org/wiki/CodeReviewComments#package-comments). <!-- golint -->
